channel.title: [PI] Price changes?
channel.description:
Ok , so i set my skillcape prices to be 99k, and they end up being 113k ingame? and then I realized its not just the skillcapes, every shop seemed to rise in the price, even though i set it at a specific. e.g
bandos tasset = 50m when i get on the server its 57m? wat? any help would be greatly appreciated, will rep ++

item.title: [PI] Price changes?
item.dc:creator: @jake.bellotti jake.bellotti
item.description:
@jake.bellotti wrote:

In shophandler.java
It’s something like this: (can’t remember what it actually is)
shopValue *1.15;
This simply means that the buying price is 1.15x the price set in prices.txt.
Change it to shopValue *1;
And you should be alright. Correct me if i’m wrong, but I’m trying to help you, not spoonfeed you.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Price changes?

item.description:

You cant repp yet:P

i really dont care, i just want to fix this freakin problem lmfao

item.title: [PI] Price changes?
item.dc:creator: @iHype iHype
item.description:
@iHype wrote:

[quote=“emtrescue, post:4, topic:458589”][quote author=iHype link=topic=561504.msg4095928#msg4095928 date=1346826384]

prices.java or sometimes its in item.cfg the first three things idk i havn’t worked with your base ina long time.

no it wouldn’t be in the item.java.
Thats where you make a description of the item, and give it stat bonuses.
prices.java are already set at 50M and i made damn sure there were no dupes of the item ID in the prices.java file.
Erg, this is irritating… :L
[/quote]
item.cfg he is right, you have to take the exception out that loads the prices from prices.java, the first three numbers are alch, buy, sell[/quote]

Uh, so how would I go about fixing this?

Read full topic
